articles.headline: Trump’s $4.8 Trillion Budget Would Cut Safety Net Programs and Boost Defense
articles.snippet: The budget, while largely a messaging document, reflects the administration’s spending priorities’ stark contrast with the president’s Democratic rivals.
articles.abstract: The budget, while largely a messaging document, reflects the administration’s spending priorities’ stark contrast with the president’s Democratic rivals.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump released a $4.8 trillion budget proposal on Monday that includes a familiar list of deep cuts to student loan assistance, affordable housing efforts, food stamps and Medicaid, reflecting Mr. Trump’s election-year effort to continue shrinking the federal safety net.
articles.byline: By Jim Tankersley, Margot Sanger-Katz, Alan Rappeport and Emily Cochrane

articles.headline: ‘Like Europe in Medieval Times’: Virus Slows China’s Economy
articles.snippet: Workers can’t return to their jobs as supply lines get snarled, extending the forced holiday and fracturing the country.
articles.abstract: Workers can’t return to their jobs as supply lines get snarled, extending the forced holiday and fracturing the country.
articles.lead_paragraph: Workers are stuck in their hometowns. Officials want detailed health plans before factories or offices can reopen. Assembly lines that make General Motors cars and Apple iPhones are standing silent.

articles.headline: Judge Is Said to Rule for T-Mobile Merger With Sprint
articles.snippet: A last-ditch attempt by a coalition of state attorneys general is said to have failed to halt T-Mobile’s purchase of a smaller rival.
articles.abstract: A last-ditch attempt by a coalition of state attorneys general is said to have failed to halt T-Mobile’s purchase of a smaller rival.
articles.lead_paragraph: The judge in a contentious lawsuit that tried to stop the long-in-the-works merger between T-Mobile and Sprint is planning to rule in favor of the deal, according to three people briefed on the matter.
articles.byline: By Edmund Lee and Andrew Ross Sorkin

articles.headline: Elizabeth Warren Is Running Her Race. The Real One May Be Passing Her By.
articles.snippet: The candidate keeps talking about winning “unwinnable fights.” But the New Hampshire primary was not supposed to be in that category.
articles.abstract: The candidate keeps talking about winning “unwinnable fights.” But the New Hampshire primary was not supposed to be in that category.
articles.lead_paragraph: CONCORD, N.H. — Two days before a once-mission-critical primary in a state she neighbors, Senator Elizabeth Warren — typically exceptional at holding a room — had not finished speaking when something unusual happened: Dozens of voters began filtering out of the middle school gym she had reserved.

articles.headline: She Wants to Break Up Big Everything
articles.snippet: Trustbusting advocates like Sarah Miller, who target corporate power, have finally found themselves at the center of the political conversation.
articles.abstract: Trustbusting advocates like Sarah Miller, who target corporate power, have finally found themselves at the center of the political conversation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — One night five years ago, Sarah Miller, a former Treasury Department aide, was trying to make sense of an economic recovery that had left the country in the grips of rising inequality.

articles.headline: A Pedophile Writer Is on Trial. So Are the French Elites.
articles.snippet: For decades, Gabriel Matzneff wrote openly of his pedophilia, protected by powerful people in publishing, journalism, politics and business. Now cast out, he attacks their “cowardice” in a rare interview.
articles.abstract: For decades, Gabriel Matzneff wrote openly of his pedophilia, protected by powerful people in publishing, journalism, politics and business. Now cast out, he attacks their “cowardice” in a rare interview.
articles.lead_paragraph: PARIS — Gabriel Matzneff, the French writer under investigation for his promotion of pedophilia, was holed up this month inside a luxury hotel room on the Italian Riviera, unable to relax, unable to sleep, unable to write.
